questions.question: What does DevOps stand for?
questions.correctAnswer: Development and Operations

questions.question: What is CI/CD?
questions.correctAnswer: Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment

questions.question: What is Git?
questions.correctAnswer: A distributed version control system

questions.question: What is Docker?
options: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers
questions.correctAnswer: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers

questions.question: What is Kubernetes?
questions.correctAnswer: An open-source container orchestration system

questions.question: What is Jenkins?
questions.correctAnswer: An open source automation server

questions.question: What is Infrastructure as Code (IaC)?
options: Managing and provisioning computer data centers through machine-readable definition files
questions.correctAnswer: Managing and provisioning computer data centers through machine-readable definition files

questions.question: Which of these is a cloud provider?
questions.correctAnswer: AWS

questions.question: What is 'sudo'?
options: super user do (execute command as administrator)
questions.correctAnswer: super user do (execute command as administrator)

questions.question: What is SSH?
questions.correctAnswer: Secure Shell

questions.question: What is Ansible?
options: An open-source software provisioning, configuration management, and application-deployment tool
questions.correctAnswer: An open-source software provisioning, configuration management, and application-deployment tool

questions.question: What is Terraform?
options: An open-source infrastructure as code software tool
questions.correctAnswer: An open-source infrastructure as code software tool

questions.question: What is a 'Container'?
options: A standard unit of software that packages up code and all its dependencies
questions.correctAnswer: A standard unit of software that packages up code and all its dependencies

questions.question: What is 'The Cloud'?
options: Servers that are accessed over the Internet
questions.correctAnswer: Servers that are accessed over the Internet

questions.question: What is 'Nagios'?
questions.correctAnswer: A monitoring system

questions.question: What is 'ELK Stack'?
questions.correctAnswer: Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana

questions.question: What is 'Blue-Green Deployment'?
options: A technique that reduces downtime and risk by running two identical production environments
questions.correctAnswer: A technique that reduces downtime and risk by running two identical production environments

questions.question: What is 'Canary Release'?
options: Rolling out a change to a small subset of users before everyone else
questions.correctAnswer: Rolling out a change to a small subset of users before everyone else

questions.question: What is 'Microservices'?
options: Architectural style that structures an application as a collection of services
questions.correctAnswer: Architectural style that structures an application as a collection of services

questions.question: What is 'Load Balancer'?
options: Device that acts as a reverse proxy and distributes network or application traffic across a number of servers
questions.correctAnswer: Device that acts as a reverse proxy and distributes network or application traffic across a number of servers

questions.question: What is 'Nginx'?
options: Web server / reverse proxy / load balancer
questions.correctAnswer: Web server / reverse proxy / load balancer

questions.question: What is 'Cron'?
questions.correctAnswer: Time-based job scheduler

questions.question: What is 'S3'?
questions.correctAnswer: Amazon Simple Storage Service

questions.question: What is 'EC2'?
questions.correctAnswer: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud

questions.question: What is 'GitOps'?
options: Using Git repositories as a single source of truth for infrastructure and application code
questions.correctAnswer: Using Git repositories as a single source of truth for infrastructure and application code

questions.question: What is 'Chaos Engineering'?
options: The discipline of experimenting on a system in order to build confidence in the system's capability to withstand turbulent conditions
questions.correctAnswer: The discipline of experimenting on a system in order to build confidence in the system's capability to withstand turbulent conditions

questions.question: What is 'Prometheus'?
questions.correctAnswer: Open-source monitoring and alerting toolkit

questions.question: What is 'Grafana'?
options: Open source analytics & monitoring solution for every database
questions.correctAnswer: Open source analytics & monitoring solution for every database

questions.question: What is 'Reverse Proxy'?
options: A server that sits in front of one or more web servers, intercepting requests from clients
questions.correctAnswer: A server that sits in front of one or more web servers, intercepting requests from clients

questions.question: What is 'Immutable Infrastructure'?
options: Infrastructure that is replaced rather than modified
questions.correctAnswer: Infrastructure that is replaced rather than modified

questions.question: What is 'Service Mesh' (e.g., Istio)?
options: A dedicated infrastructure layer for facilitating service-to-service communications
questions.correctAnswer: A dedicated infrastructure layer for facilitating service-to-service communications

questions.question: What is 'Serverless'?
options: A cloud execution model where the cloud provider runs the server, and dynamically manages the allocation of machine resources
questions.correctAnswer: A cloud execution model where the cloud provider runs the server, and dynamically manages the allocation of machine resources

questions.question: What is 'Sidecar Pattern'?
options: Attaching a supporting process/container to a main application container
questions.correctAnswer: Attaching a supporting process/container to a main application container

questions.question: What is 'Pod' in Kubernetes?
options: The smallest deployable units of computing that you can create and manage in Kubernetes
questions.correctAnswer: The smallest deployable units of computing that you can create and manage in Kubernetes

questions.question: What is 'Helm'?
questions.correctAnswer: The package manager for Kubernetes

questions.question: What is 'Scaling Up' vs 'Scaling Out'?
questions.correctAnswer: Vertical (more power) vs Horizontal (more machines)

questions.question: What is 'Zero Downtime Deployment'?
options: Updating the application without interrupting service
questions.correctAnswer: Updating the application without interrupting service

questions.question: What is 'Bash'?
questions.correctAnswer: Bourne Again SHell

questions.question: What is 'Sticky Session'?
options: Directing all requests from a client to the same backend server
questions.correctAnswer: Directing all requests from a client to the same backend server

questions.question: What is '502 Bad Gateway'?
options: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server
questions.correctAnswer: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server

questions.question: What is 'DevSecOps'?
options: Integrating security practices into the DevOps process
questions.correctAnswer: Integrating security practices into the DevOps process

questions.question: What is 'Artifact'?
options: A file produced by a build process (e.g., JAR, WAR, EXE)
questions.correctAnswer: A file produced by a build process (e.g., JAR, WAR, EXE)

questions.question: What is 'DaemonSet' in Kubernetes?
options: Ensures that all (or some) Nodes run a copy of a Pod
questions.correctAnswer: Ensures that all (or some) Nodes run a copy of a Pod

questions.question: What is 'Overlay Network'?
options: A virtual network that is built on top of another network
questions.correctAnswer: A virtual network that is built on top of another network

questions.question: What is 'Zombie Process'?
options: A process that has completed execution but still has an entry in the process table
questions.correctAnswer: A process that has completed execution but still has an entry in the process table

questions.question: What is 'Idempotency' in Ansible?
options: Running the same playbook multiple times should produce the same result
questions.correctAnswer: Running the same playbook multiple times should produce the same result

questions.question: What is 'Pipeline'?
options: A set of automated processes that allow developers to compile, build, and deploy code
questions.correctAnswer: A set of automated processes that allow developers to compile, build, and deploy code

questions.question: What is 'Elasticsearch'?
options: A distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine
questions.correctAnswer: A distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine

questions.question: What is 'VPC'?
questions.correctAnswer: Virtual Private Cloud

questions.question: What is 'Chmod'?
options: Command to change file mode bits (permissions)
questions.correctAnswer: Command to change file mode bits (permissions)
